Name: craigslist-ad-extractor
Label: Craigslist - Ad - Info
Description: This script automates the extraction of images and geolocation data from Craigslist postings, enabling efficient collection and analysis of publicly available information. It gathers visual content and location details to provide geographic context, identify visual clues, and detect patterns across ads. This capability is crucial for OSINT investigations, as it aids in tracking illegal activities, uncovering scams, and linking multiple postings to common sources. By automating this process, the script enhances efficiency and provides actionable insights for law enforcement, cybersecurity, investigative journalism, and market analysis, making it a powerful tool for monitoring and analysis in OSINT workflows.

Name: sec-edgar
Label: SEC EDGAR
Description: The SEC's EDGAR (Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval) system is a publicly accessible online database maintained by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). It serves as a repository for financial filings and disclosures that publicly traded companies, mutual funds, and other entities are required to submit under federal securities laws. Users can access a wealth of information, including annual and quarterly financial reports (Form 10-K and Form 10-Q), insider trading activities (Form 4), IPO filings (Form S-1), and proxy statements (Form DEF 14A). In open-source intelligence (OSINT), EDGAR is a critical tool for conducting due diligence, investigating corporate governance, tracking insider activities, and identifying trends in financial and business strategies. Analysts leverage this data to uncover financial stability, relationships between companies, and even early signs of potential fraud or legal risks. The platform's transparency empowers researchers, investors, and journalists to derive actionable insights from a rich trove of regulatory filings.

Name: sos-business-search
Label: California - Secretary of State - Business Search
Description:
The California Business Search provides access to available information for corporations, limited liability companies and limited partnerships of record with the California Secretary of State, with free PDF copies of over 17 million imaged business entity documents, including the most recent imaged Statements of Information filed for Corporations and Limited Liability Companies.

Currently, information for Limited Liability Partnerships (e.g. law firms, architecture firms, engineering firms, public accountancy firms, and land survey firms), General Partnerships, and other entity types are not contained in the California Business Search. If you wish to obtain information about LLPs and GPs, submit a Business Entities Order paper form to request copies of filings for these entity types. Note: This search is not intended to serve as a name reservation search. To reserve an entity name, select Forms on the left panel and select Entity Name Reservation ? Corporation, LLC, LP.

Name: lara-by-name
Label: Licensing and Regulatory Affairs (LARA) - Search by Name - US - Michigan
Description:
The Michigan LARA Corporation Search (accessible at https://cofs.lara.state.mi.us/SearchApi/Search/Search) is an online tool provided by the Michigan Department of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs (LARA). It allows users to search for detailed information about businesses and entities registered in the state of Michigan. This includes corporations, limited liability companies (LLCs), limited partnerships (LPs), and other business entities.

Users can perform searches by entity name, identification number, or keyword to access records such as:

Registration status
Business entity type
Filing details
Principal office address
Resident agent information
This tool is particularly useful for verifying the legitimacy of businesses, conducting due diligence, and retrieving official documents related to business filings in Michigan. It is a free resource and is regularly updated to provide the most accurate and current information available.

Name: lara-by-org-name
Label: Licensing and Regulatory Affairs (LARA) - Search by Organization Name - US - Michigan  ಠ_ಠ
Description:
The Michigan LARA Corporation Search (accessible at https://cofs.lara.state.mi.us/SearchApi/Search/Search) is an online tool provided by the Michigan Department of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs (LARA). It allows users to search for detailed information about businesses and entities registered in the state of Michigan. This includes corporations, limited liability companies (LLCs), limited partnerships (LPs), and other business entities.

Users can perform searches by entity name, identification number, or keyword to access records such as:

Registration status
Business entity type
Filing details
Principal office address
Resident agent information
This tool is particularly useful for verifying the legitimacy of businesses, conducting due diligence, and retrieving official documents related to business filings in Michigan. It is a free resource and is regularly updated to provide the most accurate and current information available.

Name: browser-download
Label: Download
Description: Download the OSINT LIAR data to your local download folder.

Name: live-page
Label: Live Page
Description: Open a browser tab for the given URL

Name: url-scan-io
Label: Url Scan IO
Description: urlscan.io is a critical tool for OSINT investigations due to its ability to provide detailed, automated analysis of websites and URLs. By offering insights into the behavior, structure, and connections of websites, it helps investigators uncover hidden relationships, detect threats, and maintain operational security. The metrics provided by urlscan.io are not only technical but also actionable, enabling investigators to piece together broader narratives in cybersecurity, fraud detection, and other OSINT-driven fields.

Name: fps-address
Label: Fast People Search - Address
Description: The Address Lookup feature on Fast People Search enables users to gather detailed information linked to a specific address, including current and past residents, property ownership, and historical occupancy records. It can also verify address validity, explore neighbor connections, and uncover property details such as value and past sales. This tool is valuable for OSINT investigations, allowing users to locate individuals, cross-reference data, and build comprehensive profiles. It supports due diligence, real estate research, and background investigations by providing efficient access to address-based insights.

Name: fps-phone
Label: Fast People Search - Phone
Description: The phone lookup feature on the Fast People Search website allows users to search for detailed information associated with a phone number. This includes identifying the owner's name, address, and potentially related individuals or businesses. It can also provide insights into the phone type (mobile, landline, or VoIP) and geographic location. This tool is useful for verifying unknown callers, reconnecting with acquaintances, or conducting background research. It serves as a valuable resource for personal inquiries or Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT) investigations by offering quick and accessible public data.

Name: cyber-chef
Label: Cyber Chef
Description:
The Cyber Swiss Army Knife
CyberChef is a simple, intuitive web app for carrying out all manner of "cyber" operations within a web browser. These operations include simple encoding like XOR and Base64, more complex encryption like AES, DES and Blowfish, creating binary and hexdumps, compression and decompression of data, calculating hashes and checksums, IPv6 and X.509 parsing, changing character encodings, and much more.

The tool is designed to enable both technical and non-technical analysts to manipulate data in complex ways without having to deal with complex tools or algorithms. It was conceived, designed, built and incrementally improved by an analyst in their 10% innovation time over several years.

Name: google-in-text-username
Label: Google Search - InText - Username
Description: Google Search - InText - Username is essential for OSINT research as it allows investigators to find web pages where a specific username appears within the page's content. This search operator is invaluable for uncovering mentions in forums, comments, articles, or other text-heavy platforms. By pinpointing these references, researchers can gain deeper insights into a target's online presence, activities, and potential affiliations, making it a crucial tool for digital investigations.

Name: google-in-title-username
Label: Google Search - InTitle - Username
Description: Google Search - InTitle - Username is a powerful tool for OSINT research as it enables investigators to locate web pages where a specific username appears in the title. This search operator is particularly useful for identifying profiles, posts, and pages directly associated with a target username, offering insights into their online activity. By narrowing search results to relevant content, it helps researchers efficiently uncover connections and digital footprints.

Name: google-in-url-username
Label: Google InUrl Username
Description: Google InUrl Username is crucial for OSINT research as it allows investigators to locate web pages where a specific username appears within the URL. This technique helps uncover user profiles, forums, repositories, and other online platforms associated with the target username. By leveraging this search operator, researchers can efficiently map a subject's digital footprint, identify hidden accounts, and gather valuable intelligence for investigations.

Name: experian-phone-verification
Label: Experian Phone Verification
Description:
The EDQ Free Phone Verification Tool is a web-based service designed to validate and verify phone numbers worldwide. It determines the validity of a number, identifies its type (mobile, landline, or VoIP), and provides additional insights such as carrier information and geographic location. This tool is essential for businesses and organizations aiming to enhance contact data accuracy, reduce communication errors, and improve customer outreach.

In the context of OSINT (Open-Source Intelligence), the EDQ tool is valuable for verifying phone numbers during investigations, ensuring that collected data is accurate and actionable. It aids in identifying the legitimacy of a phone number, reducing false leads, and improving the reliability of intelligence gathering efforts.

Name: ipqs-phone-validator
Label: IPQS - US - Phone Validator
Description:
IPQualityScore Phone Number Validator is a powerful tool for verifying and analyzing phone numbers worldwide. It determines the validity, carrier, line type (mobile, landline, or VoIP), geographic location, and even the risk level of a phone number. This service is widely used for fraud prevention, improving communication accuracy, and ensuring compliance with regulations.

In the context of Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT), this tool is invaluable for identifying and validating phone numbers during investigations. It helps analysts uncover connections between individuals or entities, assess the legitimacy of contact information, and reduce the noise caused by false or invalid data. By providing actionable insights, it supports thorough research and enhances the credibility of findings in OSINT workflows.

Name: phone-validator
Label: Phone Validator
Description: Phone Validator is an online tool designed to validate and verify phone numbers in the United States. It identifies whether a number is valid, active, and determines its type—landline, mobile, or VoIP. The service also provides information such as the carrier name and geographic location associated with the number. Phone Validator is useful for businesses, marketers, and organizations seeking to clean and optimize contact lists, reduce fraud, and improve communication efficiency. Its simple interface allows users to quickly input numbers for instant results.

Name: reverse-phone-checker
Label: Reverse Phone Check
Description: Reverse Phone Check is an online tool designed to provide detailed information about a phone number, such as the owner’s name, location, carrier, and potential related public records. By simply entering a phone number, users can uncover valuable insights that aid in identifying unknown callers, verifying identities, or gathering data for investigations. This tool is particularly important for OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) as it enables investigators to connect phone numbers to individuals or organizations, uncover potential relationships, and cross-reference data with other sources. Reverse Phone Check plays a critical role in digital forensics, fraud detection, and personal investigations, offering a non-intrusive yet effective way to enhance data collection and analysis.

Name: whats-my-name
Label: Whats My Name
Description: WhatMyName.app is a web-based tool designed to assist in digital investigations and OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) efforts by identifying usernames across various online platforms. It provides a user-friendly interface to search for a specific username and returns a comprehensive list of sites where that username is registered. This tool is invaluable for investigators, researchers, and cybersecurity professionals looking to track digital footprints, verify accounts, or uncover potential aliases. By aggregating data from a wide range of websites, WhatMyName.app simplifies the process of discovering a user's online presence.

Name: who-am-i
Label: Who Am I
Description: Who Am I is a Chrome extension designed for efficient username enumeration across multiple websites and social media platforms. Built for Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) investigations, it leverages datasets like WhatsMyName, Sherlock, and Mine Sight to quickly verify usernames with real-time feedback. With features like customizable searches, privacy-focused design, and an intuitive interface, Who Am I streamlines digital investigations, making it an essential tool for researchers, investigators, and professionals.
